<target_code>
Here is the code of try_get_value:
```c
static void
try_get_value (const char *buf,
               const char *key,
               char **destination)
{
  const char *spos;
  const char *bpos;
  const char *endv;
  size_t klen;
  size_t vlen;

  if (NULL != *destination)
    return;
  bpos = buf;
  klen = strlen (key);
  while (NULL != (spos = strstr (bpos, key)))
  {
    if ( (spos[klen] != '=') ||
         ( (spos != buf) &&
           (spos[-1] != ' ') ) )
    {
      /* no match */
      bpos = spos + 1;
      continue;
    }
    if (spos[klen + 1] != '"')
      return;                   /* not quoted */
    if (NULL == (endv = strchr (&spos[klen + 2],
                                '\"')))
      return;                   /* no end-quote */
    vlen = (size_t) (endv - spos) - klen - 1;
    *destination = malloc (vlen);
    if (NULL == *destination)
      return;                   /* out of memory */
    (*destination)[vlen - 1] = '\0';
    memcpy (*destination,
            &spos[klen + 2],
            vlen - 1);
    return;                     /* success */
  }
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: MISRA C Rule 17.2 concerns direct or indirect recursion. The only parts of this function that can introduce indirect recursion are calls to other functions (they might, in some build/configuration, call back into try_get_value). The listed fragments are all function-call expressions present in the code. Other code fragments (variable declarations, pointer arithmetic, index checks like spos[klen], conditional checks, assignments, returns, the NULL checks, the loop control and string literal usage) do not invoke any functions and therefore cannot by themselves create direct or indirect recursion; they do not need investigation for Rule 17.2. Also there are no function pointer calls or references to try_get_value within the function body, so no other constructs are relevant to potential recursion.
